issues.description: Aufgabe 06 (Problem statement) asks for the COUNT of Wanderwege that lead to Gemeinden with mehr als 500000 mÃ¤nnlichen Einwohnern, but the solution (solution_repository/aufgabe06.sql) uses SELECT * and returns rows instead of a count. This contradicts the stated expected result type/shape and will confuse students about what output is required and how to aggregate the data. It also fails to clarify whether distinct Wanderwege should be counted (COUNT(*) vs COUNT(DISTINCT ...)).
issues.suggested_fix:
Update the solution to return a single numeric count as requested. For example, to count distinct Wanderwege that lead to such Gemeinden use:

SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Wanderweg_zu_Gemeinde.radweg_id)
FROM Wanderweg_zu_Gemeinde
JOIN Gemeinde ON Gemeinde.schluessel = Wanderweg_zu_Gemeinde.gemeindeschluessel
WHERE Gemeinde.einwohner_m > 500000;

If the intended interpretation is to count row-mappings (not distinct Wanderwege), use SELECT COUNT(*) with the same FROM/JOIN/WHERE. Also ensure the template hints (if any) reflect the counting requirement so students are not left to infer the expected output shape.
